DOC.brief_title: Effect Iron/Zinc-biofortified Pearl Millet Growth , Immunity , Cognition Children Aged 12-18 Months India
DOC.detailed_description: Iron zinc deficiency remain major worldwide public health problem , especially develop country India . In randomized study , 700 child age 12-18 month Mumbai , Maharashtra , India feed either iron zinc biofortified pearl millet control pearl millet three time per day , six day per week , nine month . The goal study examine effect iron zinc biofortified millet immune function , growth , cognitive function age group . The key outcome measure biomarkers iron zinc status , growth , immune cognitive function . Serum concentration hemoglobin , ferritin , serum transferrin receptor , zinc assess enrollment ( baseline ) , intermediate time point ( midline ; random serial sampling ) 9 month follow-up ( endline ) . Additionally , measure concentration C-reactive protein ( CRP ) alpha 1-acid glycoprotein ( AGP ) , iron zinc biomarkers influence inflammation . To assess cognitive function , multiple specific aspect memory , attention , process speed assess . Higher-level , integrative cognitive ability require coordination multiple specific function , problem-solving exploratory behavior global aspect attention free play toy , also assess . In addition , Bayley III test conduct baseline , intermediate , endline assessment obtain broad measure attainment developmental milestone use compare characteristic cohort report literature .
